member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TimeHelpers
member.summary:
Methods to assist with working with times. Configuration Manager uses several different types of time internally and this encapsulates many of them.
Supported time formats include ISO 8601,
CIM time (called SMS time in the some of the methods and properties in this class)
, COM FILETIME, Win32 SystemTime, "SMS Cookie" time, and CTime/time_t/UNIX time.
Conversion from and too these formats is supported in most cases.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation
member.summary: enum for the token information

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.None
member.summary: No token information

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenUser
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_USER structure that contains the user account of the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the group accounts associated with the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenPrivileges
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_PRIVILEGES structure that contains the privileges of the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenOwner
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_OWNER structure that contains the default owner security identifier (SID) for newly created objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenPrimaryGroup
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_PRIMARY_GROUP structure that contains the default primary group SID for newly created objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenDefaultDacl
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_DEFAULT_DACL structure that contains the default DACL for newly created objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenSource
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_SOURCE structure that contains the source of the token. TOKEN_QUERY_SOURCE access is needed to retrieve this information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenType
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_TYPE value that indicates whether the token is a primary or impersonation token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenImpersonationLevel
member.summary: The buffer receives a SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL value that indicates the impersonation level of the token. If the access token is not an impersonation token, the function fails.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenStatistics
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_STATISTICS structure that contains various token statistics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenRestrictedSids
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the list of restricting SIDs in a restricted token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenSessionId
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that indicates the Terminal Services session identifier that is associated with the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenGroupsAndPrivileges
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS_AND_PRIVILEGES structure that contains the user SID, the group accounts, the restricted SIDs, and the authentication ID associated with the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenSessionReference
member.summary: Reserved

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenSandboxInert
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token includes the SANDBOX_INERT flag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenAuditPolicy
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenOrigin
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ORIGIN value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenElevationType
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ELEVATION_TYPE value that specifies the elevation level of the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenLinkedToken
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_LINKED_TOKEN structure that contains a handle to another token that is linked to this token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenElevation
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ELEVATION structure that specifies whether the token is elevated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenHasRestrictions
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has ever been filtered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenAccessInformation
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ACCESS_INFORMATION structure that specifies security information contained in the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenVirtualizationAllowed
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is allowed for the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenVirtualizationEnabled
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is enabled for the token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenIntegrityLevel
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL structure that specifies the token's integrity level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenUIAccess
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has the UIAccess flag set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenMandatoryPolicy
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_MANDATORY_POLICY structure that specifies the token's mandatory integrity policy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.TokenLogOnSid
member.summary: The buffer receives the token's logon security identifier (SID).

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.TokenInformation.MaxTokenInfoClass
member.summary: The maximum value for this enumeration

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState
member.summary: enum for the WTS connect state

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsActive
member.summary: A user is logged on to the WinStation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsConnected
member.summary: The WinStation is connected to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsConnectQuery
member.summary: The WinStation is in the process of connecting to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsShadow
member.summary: The WinStation is shadowing another WinStation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsDisconnected
member.summary: The WinStation is active but the client is disconnected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsIdle
member.summary: The WinStation is waiting for a client to connect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsListen
member.summary: The WinStation is listening for a connection. A listener session waits for requests for new client connections. No user is logged on a listener session. A listener session cannot be reset, shadowed, or changed to a regular client session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsReset
member.summary: The WinStation is being reset.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsDown
member.summary: The WinStation is down due to an error.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.WtsConnectState.WtsInit
member.summary: The WinStation is initializing.

Settings recognized by the HTTP/MP sender
Recognized options (case sensitive):
IsUpload (bool) ==> is message an upload message (has different handling by MP Verb (string) ==> verb to use when making the HTTP request (default is CCM_POST) Uri (string) ==> URI to send to on the MP, often context sensitive if undefined, default is generally /ccm_system/request HttpHeaders (Dictionary<string,object>) ==> Collection of special headers to overload in the message

member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSenderEventArgs.Message
member.summary:
The message for the event. This instance can be changed by the recipient and the callee of the method will receive the changed instance.
If the message is being delivered, the modified message will be delivered to the endpoint and the local variable parameter will be changed.
If the message is being received, the modified message will be delivered to the callee with the modified data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings
member.summary: Contains settings shared by all message types for sending a message to a management point. Not all properties are recognized by all senders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.DefaultHttpPort
member.summary: Default port for HTTP communication

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.DefaultHttpsPort
member.summary: Default port for HTTPS communication

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes static members of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.DefaultSecurityMode
member.summary:
This setting controls the default security mode for messages. This is static so this will carry across the entire process.
Defaults to mixed mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.BitsUpload
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether BITS will be used to send the message payload to the MP. Not all Management Point endpoints are compatible with BITS so use care when setting this to true. Not all senders support BITS uploading.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.BitsOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets additional options for BITS uploads

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression used with this message

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level used for sending compression. This is ignored unless compression is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.Endpoint
member.remarks: Do not set this unless you know what you are doing
member.value: Endpoint name. It is not recommended to change this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.HostName
member.summary: Gets or sets the management point hostname that the message will be sent to.
member.value: Management point hostname

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.HttpPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP port to use for sending the message if applicable. Not all senders will recognize this property value. For best compatibility, should be used to get the most appropriate port.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.HttpsPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTPS (TLS/SSL) port to use for sending the message if applicable. Not all senders will recognize this property value. For best compatibility, should be used to get the most appropriate port.
member.remarks: This must be set or else message validation will fail
member.value: Port ranging from 1-65536

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.MessageProperties
member.summary: Gets any special message properties. This is generally used by messages and should not be set by external code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.MessageSourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional source type for the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.OverrideValidityChecks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ability to override validity checking is enabled. If true, messages that have required properties that are null or empty will not fail to send.
member.remarks: It is not recommended that this be set to false except in the case of extreme performance optimization.
member.value: Setting to true means validation will be skipped before sending message. It is not recommended to do this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.PostSendActionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a post-send asynchronous task should be run if supported by the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.ReplyCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the reply compression used with this message

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.ReplyEndpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the endpoint to direct replies to. This setting is only relevant for senders and it is not recommended that this is changed manually unless under very special circumstances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.Security
member.summary: Gets the security settings for the message

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.SecurityMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the site security mode. Default value is mixed mode

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.SenderProperties
member.summary: Gets any special configuration settings for specific senders. Some messages may require special sender-specific settings that can be set here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.ServerRoleType
member.summary: Gets or sets optional server role type for the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.SourceHost
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname that the message is sourced from. Defaults to the local machine's NETBIOS name, but can be any value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.Timeout
member.summary: Get or sets the timeout for sending message. Not all senders will honor this timeout value. Default is 60 seconds.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.CloneSettings(Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings)
member.summary: Clones settings between instances. This can be used to preserve settings from one message to another. Not all settings will be cloned as some are implementation-specific to a message.
member.param: The source settings object. Those settings will be cloned into this object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.CloneSettings(Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings,Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageCloneOptions)
member.summary: Clones settings between instances. This can be used to preserve settings from one message to another. Not all settings will be cloned as some are implementation-specific to a message.
member.param: The source settings object. Those settings will be cloned into this object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.GetCommunicationPort
member.summary:
Gets the communication port that should be used for communication. The port that is returned depends on the setting for . If a specific override is required, use
instead.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.GetCommunicationPort(Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSecurityMode)
member.summary: Gets the communication port that should be used for communication. This is a hint and the actual port that should be used is specific to the implementation

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettings.SetCommunicationPort(Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSecurityMode,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Sets the communication port that should be used for communication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity
member.summary: Message security flags

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: Gets/sets the authentication scheme for the request. Default for this is NTLM. This is ignored unless connecting using authentication

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.AuthenticationType
member.summary: Gets/sets the authentication type for the request. Some messages have special authentication requirements. The default for this is Automatic

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.Credentials
member.summary:
Credentials to attach to the request. If null, no credentials will be used.
IMPORTANT: This setting does not imply the WindowsAuth authentication type. If this is set and WindowsAuth is not set, these credentials will be used with the default ISAPI. If Automatic is used, the VDIR will be determined by the message itself.
member.remarks: NetworkCredential is not serializable and will always be null if remoting is used

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.EncryptionVersion
member.summary: Encryption version to use for getting the necessary encryption information from the management point

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.EncryptMessage
member.summary: Get/Set encryption message flag
member.value: If true message will be encrypted. Not all endpoints on the remote MP will recognize encrypted message. It is not necessary to enable encryption if native mode is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.SigningSmsId
member.summary: Get/Set SMSID used for signing the message.
member.remarks: Setting this value to a non-null value means that the message will be signed. If this is set and a signing certificate is added, message sending will fail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.EncryptionCertificate
member.summary: Get/set the encryption certificate used for messages

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.MessageSettingsSecurity.ManagementPointSigningCertificate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the signing certificate of the management point.

member.summary: Gets/sets the trace switch. The default name for the trace switch is "Messaging Logging"

Putting this in your app.config will only log warnings and errors
<configuration> <system.diagnostics> <switches> <add name="Messaging Logging" value="Warning" /> </switches> </system.diagnostics> </configuration>

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Framework.SupportedSenderAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute that notes what senders can send the message. Not all senders can send all messages. If this attribute is empty, or not defined, it is equivalent to all senders. This is only valid as a class decoration.
You can define multiple SupportedSenderAttributes for a class.

member.summary:
Connects to WMI on a remote machine with specified credentials and gets the WMI instances from a class. The real WMI class is overwritten with SpoofWmiClass.
This is useful when the client isn't installed

member.summary: Retrieves instances from WMI
member.param: hostname to connect to -- if null, uses localhost
overrides in the inventory the WMI namespace with value selected here, if not defined, scope will be used
overrides in the inventory the WMI class with value selected here, if not defined, wmiClass will be used
credentials for connecting to remote hostname -- if null, uses no credentials. Ignored if hostName is null

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase
member.summary:
Base class used for creating SCCM client registration requests
Registration is different in ConfigMgr 2007 versus ConfigMgr 2012, use the libary appropriate for this request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.AddRegistrationHint
member.summary: If true, a registration hint will be added to the message before sending.

member.summary: Get/Set agent identity. Usually something like "MyClient.exe"

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.AgentType
member.summary: Get/Set the agent type. Current valid agent types are 0=AdvancedClient, 1=OsdCD, 2=Device, 4=IsvProxy, 8=IsvProxyClient

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.AgentVersion
member.summary: Get/Set the agent version. Defaults to null
member.remarks: AgentVersion is a required property and must be set

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.ClientFqdn
member.summary: The client FQDN of the registering machine. If unset, this will use the NetBiosName value.
member.remarks: ClientFqdn is a required property and must be set

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.DiscoveryProperties
member.summary: Get/Set the discovery properties. This is not used in confirmation requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.EncryptionCertificate
member.summary: The encryption certificate used to include in the registration request

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.HardwareId
member.summary: The Hardware ID of the registering machine. Hardware IDs are used to identify the machine hardware. Any string provided will suffice as a hardware id, as long as it's unique to a machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.InternetStatus
member.summary: Client's Internet status. Defaults to None (0)

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.LocaleId
member.summary: The locale ID of the registering machine. Defaults to the locale ID of the calling machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.NetBiosName
member.summary: The NetBIOS name of the registering machine. This is a required property.
member.remarks: This is a required property and must be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.RegistrationHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the registration hint to use for registering with the site server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.RegistrationType
member.summary: Get or set the type of registration message to send (i.e.: registration or confirmation). This affects the message returned from the MP.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.ConfigMgrRegistrationRequestBase.RequestedSmsId
member.summary: Get/Set the SMSID, leave null or empty string to let the MP generate one for you if you are registering. Must be set if using for a confirmation request.

member.summary: Get/Set the SMSID that the signing the request on behalf. (Only use if you're registering AgentType 4 or AgentType 8)

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.Server.DiscoveryDataRecordFile.Architecture
member.summary:
Architecture name that can refer to an existing or new architecture.
A single word such as Car would identify the SMS_R_Car resource class
A multiword such as Carpool Intentory would identify the SMS_R_CarpoolInventory resource class
A DMTF-formatted string such as ACME|Car|1.0 would identify the SMS_R_Acme_Car_1_0 resource class
The string "System" identifies a computer system
member.value: Default is System

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.MessageTime
member.summary: The datetime for the state message. Default is Now.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.MessageTimeString
member.summary: The datetime for the state message. This is only for serialization. MessageTime should be used instead

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.SerialNumber
member.summary: Serial number for the message. Do not use for FSP messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.Site
member.summary: Site code details for replication. This is required for FSP messages and not used for regular state messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.State
member.summary: Gets/sets the state blob for the message. This is required.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.StateDetails
member.summary: State message details. Used by FSP messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.Topic
member.summary: Gets/sets the topic details for the message. This is required.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StateMessage.UserParameters
member.summary: The parameters for the message. This is required.

member.summary: An individual parameter for a state message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that defines status message metadata

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
When Name is specified, the property is serialized to XML using the name specified in Name. Otherwise, the property name that uses this attribute is used.
For example, you can create a property called MyId (which satisfies FxCop naming rules), but the XML blob is expecting MyID (which doesn't satisfy FxCop naming rules). By specifying a Name, you can have your property named MyId, but have it serialize as MyID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
When Name is specified, the property is serialized to XML using the name specified in Name. Otherwise, the property name that uses this attribute is used.
For example, you can create a property called MyId (which satisfies FxCop naming rules), but the XML blob is expecting MyID (which doesn't satisfy FxCop naming rules). By specifying a Name, you can have your property named MyId, but have it serialize as MyID.
If true, property must be set to a non-null value or else an exception will be thrown when the message is parsed

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If true, property must be set to a non-null value or else an exception will be thrown when the message is parsed

member.summary: If true, and the value is an enum, it will be represented as its integral value. If false, it will be represented as a string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Messages.StatusMessageMetadataAttribute.Name
member.summary:
When Name is specified, the property is serialized to XML using the name specified in Name. Otherwise, the property name that uses this attribute is used.

member.summary: Builds the status message's properties and qualifiers from a status message object. If you have already done a ParseMessage, doing this again will not delete the status memory in memory for this instance of this class. If this is not desirable behavior, do an Initialize() before ParseStatusMessage(...), or set InitializeOnParse to true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Sender.MPApi.MPApiSender
member.summary:
This sender uses the MP API for sending messages. The MP API is a legacy COM server that communicates with the management point. It is not recommended to use this sender except for in legacy applications. Several messages do not support this sender and will fail. The HTTP sender recommended as it takes no COM dependency and supports most message types.
It is not recommended to invoke senders directly. The recommended pattern is to use for sending/receiving data from the management point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Sender.MPApi.MPApiSender.smsMessagingClass

member.summary: Event that is fied after a message is received. The message contents can be changed before the message is returned to the caller. Only SendSync fires this event, SendAsync will not fire this event.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Sender.MPApi.MPApiSender.OnSend
member.summary: Event that is fired before a message is sent. The message contents can be changed before the message is delivered or inspected. Both SendSync and SendAsync fire this event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.Sender.Http.HttpSender
member.summary:
HTTP sender. This sender supports most message types and has no dependency on COM or a client. This is the recommended sender for sending messages to the management point.
It is not recommended to invoke senders directly. The recommended pattern is to use for sending/receiving data from the management point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.CcmHttpStatus
member.summary:
Event that denotes a certain HTTP status was sent. Can be a success or failure.
Note, this breaks the rules for severity so if you don't want this to be Informational, you must use SetStatus() to change it.

member.summary: This status message breaks the rules about severity. Use SetSeverity to set this on a per-instance basis. Defaults to Informational.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator
member.summary:
This will generate a status message and validate it. This is less free-form than AdHocStatusMessage as it actually performs validations against actual status messages.
This polls WMI so there must be an SMS client or MP installed or else this class will not work.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Gathers information from the specified status event

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. If you use this, you must make sure to invoke the GatherStatusMessageProperties method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.Severity
member.summary: Gets the message severity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.StatusMessageProperties
member.summary:
Performs consistency checks on the status message properties. This should not be invoked directly -- this should only be called by ConfigMgrStatusMessage.ParseStatusMessage(...).
This will throw an exception if any properties that are required are not set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.StatusMessageQualifiers
member.summary:
Performs consistency checks on the status message properties. This should not be invoked directly -- this should only be called by SccmStatusMessage.ParseStatusMessage(...).
This will throw an exception if any properties that are required are not set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.StatusMessageType
member.summary: Gets the status message type that is automatically parsed from the WMI event itself

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.GatherStatusMessageProperties(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to pull all of the status message information from WMI

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.GetPropertyType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the CimType for the property. When sending the status message to the MP, it always sends as an object without any validation. It's up to the user of this class to verify type correctness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ConfigurationManagement.Messaging.StatusMessages.StatusMessageGenerator.GetRequiredProperties
member.summary: Returns a list of all of the status message properties that must be set.

member.summary: Sets a qualifier's value

member.summary: Sets a property's value
